Each help topic has a full page of information. Long topics can be scrolled.

If you have an app that you want to add Help to, this demo app shows one way you can do that. All you need are two activities: one for the main Help screen and the other to display the Help text of a selected topic.

Each of the help topics has a full page of help text. The help text is defined in xml files in the resource folders of the application. If you use CDATA in the xml definitions, you can define paragraphs and text in bold and italics. Links are also supported.

Long topics can be scrolled. Try this one in both portrait and landscape orientation. You will probably have to scroll the text in landscape.

If you want all the details about how this app was constructed, touch this link to open a web browser: blahti blog.

Return to the previous screen by touching the Back button.
Learn how to display simple forms of Html in a text view. Paragraphs, bold, italics, and links are supported.

You can display simple forms of Html in a text view. You use the Html class and its fromHtml static method. See Html on Android Developers.

As shown here, paragraphs are supported, as are bold text and italics. The preceding paragraph has a link in it.

You can define links in the help text strings. To get them to work, you have to do some extra set up in the code.

You can define links in the help text strings. To get them to work, you have to do some extra set up in the code.

To understand how to do this, study LinkMovementMethod and how it is used with a TextView.

Image buttons define an image and a label on the screen. Touching an image takes you to the help text for a topic.

Image buttons define an image and a label on the screen. Touching an image takes you to the help text for a topic.

For each button, you use three images. One represents the button in its default, unselected state. The other two are used for when the button is selected and pressed. The images and the definition of the button drawable are in the drawable folders in the resource folder.

By the way, the images used in this demo app are left over from an earlier demo program. For a real app, choose images that are good fit for the help topics.
